result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Hearing on August 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:40 AM Defendant Larry D Beck in court, in custody, with attorney Jessica A Klein.   Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Klein states the defendant is on an OTP from Dodge Correctional.  The Court will change the defendant's address to reflect that he is currently at Dodge Correctional.  The State indicates a SECOND AMENDED Criminal Complaint has been filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of SECOND AMENDED complaint and waives reading of complaint.  City of Muskego Police Department Detective Natalie Johnston sworn in and testifies on direct by Attorney Will.  Cross examination by Attorney Klein.  City of Muskego Police Department Detective Timothy Sullivan sworn in and testifies on direct by Attorney Will.  Cross examination by Attorney Klein.  State rests.  State moves for bind over with argument.  Attorney Klein objects to bind over with argument and moves to dismiss.  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Defendant is to remain in the Waukesha County Jail until the next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.
SECOND AMENDED.

Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to enter the City of Muskego. 01:39 PM Defendant Larry D Beck appeared by Zoom, in custody, from Racine County Jail with attorney Jessica A Klein.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern Abigail Kincheloe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  The State to file an amended Victim Identification Key to include Victim B.  Victim B appeared by Zoom and makes statements regarding bail.  Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from Racine County Jail.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Initial appearance on June 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

The Court notes the defendant is now in the Racine County Jail and the facility was unable to accommodate a Zoom appearance.  The Court will adjourn the initial appearance.  The defendant to appear by Zoom from Racine County Jail at the next hearing.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
